tagline: Behavioral systems that make habits stick — because 'just do it' isn't a design spec
pros: Behavioral science-based habit design with cue-routine-reward structure
Data-driven weekly reviews that diagnose why habits fail
Minimum viable habits eliminate the 'too ambitious' failure mode
Zero shame approach redirects self-criticism to system improvement
cons: Focuses on habit mechanics — deeper psychological issues need other roles
Tracking requires some ongoing effort from the person
Limits to 1-3 new habits at a time, which can feel slow

model_recommendations.notes: Template-following, scheduling, tracking, simple Q&A. Lightweight models save cost without sacrificing quality for these structured tasks.
